questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site is known for its ancient cliff dwellings and served as the home of the Ancestral Puebloans in North America?
questions.context: This site features well-preserved cliff dwellings dating back over 700 years, and was discovered by local ranchers in the late 19th century.

questions.question: What famous museum, located on the banks of a river in a European city, holds one of the largest and most diverse collections of art in the world?
questions.context: Originally a royal palace, this museum houses the Mona Lisa and was significantly expanded under the leadership of Napoleon.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site, located in the Middle East, features a colossal ancient rock-cut city that became the capital of the Nabateans around the 4th century BC?
questions.context: Famous for its stunning sandstone architecture, this city was rediscovered by a Swiss explorer in 1812.

questions.question: What modern architectural marvel in Asia, opened in 2010, was the tallest building in the world at the time of its completion?
questions.context: This iconic skyscraper stands at 828 meters tall and features the world's highest observation deck.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin, located in the heart of the Andes, is considered one of the most iconic symbols of the Inca Empire?
questions.context: This 15th-century site was brought to international attention by Hiram Bingham in 1911, and is often referred to as the 'Lost City of the Incas'.
